summary: medical advice for common health issues
prompts: I've been getting these terrible headaches almost every day for the past week, usually starting around 3pm. They feel like pressure on both sides of my head. What are some ways I can try to relieve them without always reaching for ibuprofen?
what's the difference between a regular headache and a migraine? and what can i do at home to help with either one

My doctor diagnosed me with migraines and prescribed medication, but I'm looking for some natural or lifestyle changes I can make to reduce how often they happen. Do you have any suggestions for prevention methods or triggers I should avoid?

Help!! I woke up with the worst headache behind my right eye and light is making it so much worse. I already took acetaminophen an hour ago but it's not helping. What else can I try to get some relief fast? Should I be worried?
I've had a runny nose, sore throat, and mild fever for 2 days. What are the best over-the-counter medicines I should take? Also, should I be worried if my fever goes above 101°F?
how long is a typical cold supposed to last? mine started 5 days ago with sneezing and now i have chest congestion and a cough that won't go away. is this normal or should i see a doctor

My 8-year-old daughter has the flu - the doctor confirmed it yesterday. She's been vomiting and has a high fever. What can I do at home to help her feel better? Are there any warning signs I should watch for that mean we need to go to the ER?
Can you explain the difference between cold and flu symptoms? I woke up with body aches, headache, and fatigue but no runny nose. Trying to figure out if I should stay home from work tomorrow.

I've been having really bad heartburn for the past 3 days, especially after eating. It burns in my chest and sometimes I feel it in my throat. What can I do to make it stop? Are there any home remedies or over the counter meds that actually work?
help!! my stomach has been making these loud gurgling noises all day and i feel bloated even though i barely ate anything. is this normal or should i be worried

I think I might have IBS but I'm not sure. My symptoms are: alternating between constipation and diarrhea, cramping after meals, lots of gas, and sometimes mucus in stool (sorry if TMI). This has been going on for about 2 months. Does this sound like IBS to you? What should I do about it?

What's the best way to treat food poisoning at home? I ate some questionable sushi last night and now I have nausea, stomach cramps, and diarrhea. When should I consider going to the ER versus just riding it out? Also wondering if I should take Imodium or let it run its course.

I have a red, itchy rash on my forearm that appeared 2 days ago. It's about the size of a quarter and has small bumps. I haven't changed any soaps or detergents recently. What could this be and should I be worried?

help!! my 5 year old has these tiny red dots all over her chest and back since this morning. no fever but she says it's really itchy. we went to the park yesterday could it be from plants? what should i put on it

I've been dealing with patches of dry, flaky skin on my elbows and knees for months now. They're whitish and sometimes crack and bleed. I've tried regular moisturizer but it's not helping much. Is this eczema or psoriasis? What's the best over-the-counter treatment I can try?

There's a circular rash on my thigh that's been slowly getting bigger over the past week. The center is clearing up but the edges are still red and raised. It doesn't really itch or hurt. My friend said it might be ringworm - is that possible even though I haven't been around any animals? How do I treat this at home?

I've been having lower back pain for about 2 weeks now, especially when I sit at my desk for long periods. It's like a dull ache that sometimes shoots down my left leg. What could be causing this and what can I do to relieve it?
hey doc, my posture is terrible!! i work from home and slouch all day. now my upper back and neck are killing me. what are some exercises or stretches i can do throughout the day to fix this?

I recently started a warehouse job that involves a lot of lifting and bending. My back has been sore every evening when I get home. What's the proper way to lift heavy objects to avoid injury, and should I be wearing a back brace or support belt?

My teenager is always hunched over their phone and I'm worried about their posture. They're starting to complain about back pain already at 16 years old. What can I do to help them improve their posture and prevent long-term problems? Are there specific chairs or ergonomic products you'd recommend for studying?

I've been having trouble falling asleep for the past 2 weeks. It takes me like 2-3 hours just lying in bed before I can finally sleep. What can I do to fall asleep faster without using sleeping pills?

hey doc, i keep waking up at 3am every single night and cant go back to sleep no matter what i try... its been happening for a month now and im exhausted all day. what could be causing this and how do i fix it??

I work night shifts 4 days a week and my sleep schedule is completely messed up. Even on my days off I can't seem to sleep at normal times anymore. Are there any techniques or supplements that could help reset my circadian rhythm?

My partner says I snore really loudly and sometimes stop breathing for a few seconds while sleeping. I also wake up feeling tired even after 8 hours of sleep and have headaches in the morning. Could this be sleep apnea? What should I do about it?
I've been sneezing non-stop for the past 3 days and my eyes are super itchy and watery. Is this just seasonal allergies or should I be worried about something else? What can I take to make it stop?

Every spring when the trees start blooming, I get this horrible post-nasal drip that makes me cough all night. I've tried Claritin but it doesn't seem to help much. Are there better medications I should ask my doctor about, or any natural remedies that actually work?
my kid has been rubbing his nose constantly and has dark circles under his eyes... the pediatrician mentioned something about allergic shiners?? what does that mean and how do we treat it

Help! I just moved to a new city and I'm having the WORST allergy symptoms I've ever experienced - congestion, headaches, scratchy throat, the works. How do I figure out what I'm allergic to here? Should I get tested or just start taking antihistamines and see what happens?

I accidentally cut my finger while chopping vegetables and it's about half an inch long but not too deep. I've rinsed it with water but it's still bleeding a little. What's the best way to clean and bandage this?
how often should i change the bandage on a small cut? its on my hand and i wash my hands a lot during the day

My 7 year old scraped her knee pretty bad at the playground yesterday. I cleaned it and put a band-aid on, but now the area around it looks a bit red and she says it hurts more than yesterday. Should I be worried about infection? What signs should I look for?

Hey, I have a small cut that's been healing for about 4 days now but the scab keeps getting caught on my clothing and reopening. Is it better to keep it covered with a bandage or let it air dry? Also is neosporin actually helpful or is that a myth?

My 7 year old has had a fever of 101.5°F since yesterday morning. I've been giving her children's Tylenol every 6 hours but it only brings it down temporarily. Should I try alternating with ibuprofen? When should I be worried enough to go to the ER?
what's the best way to bring down a fever naturally without medication? i prefer not to use drugs unless absolutely necessary

I've been running a low-grade fever (99.5-100°F) for three days now with no other symptoms. Is this something I should monitor at home or see a doctor about? Also, is it true that you shouldn't try to reduce a mild fever because it helps fight infection?

Help! My temperature is 103.2 and I feel awful - chills, body aches, headache. I took 2 advil an hour ago but still feel terrible. How often should I be checking my temp? And at what point is a fever dangerous for adults? Should I use a cold compress or take a lukewarm bath?
I pulled something in my lower back yesterday while deadlifting at the gym. It hurts when I bend forward or twist. Should I use ice or heat? How long before I can work out again?

hey so i think i have a hamstring strain from playing soccer this weekend. its been 3 days and still pretty sore. what's the best way to treat this at home? also when do i need to actually see a doctor vs just letting it heal

My shoulder has been killing me after tennis practice. I can lift my arm but it's painful when I reach behind my back or overhead. Is this rotator cuff related? What exercises or stretches would help with recovery?

Twisted my ankle during my morning run - it's swollen and tender but I can still walk on it with some pain. Do I need an X-ray or can I just follow RICE protocol? How can I tell if it's a sprain vs something more serious?
I've been feeling really anxious lately and my heart races randomly throughout the day even when I'm just sitting at my desk. What are some techniques I can try to calm myself down when this happens?

hey doc, work has been insane and i cant sleep at night because my mind wont stop racing about all the deadlines. its been like 2 weeks of barely any sleep. what can i do to manage this stress better without medication?

I'm experiencing physical symptoms like headaches, tight shoulders, and stomach issues that I think are related to stress from caring for my elderly parent. Can you suggest some stress management strategies that actually work? I've tried deep breathing but it doesn't seem to help much.

What are the signs that my anxiety is becoming something more serious that needs professional help? I've been using meditation apps and exercise but I still have panic attacks maybe once a week and I'm wondering if this is normal or if I should see someone

I've been feeling exhausted for the past few weeks even though I'm getting 8 hours of sleep every night. I don't have any other symptoms besides being tired all the time. What could be causing this constant fatigue?

hey doc, im a 28yo male and lately ive had zero energy. like i can barely get through work without needing a nap. i eat okay and exercise sometimes. what are the most common reasons people my age feel this drained?

What medical conditions should I ask my doctor to test for if I'm experiencing chronic fatigue? I'm particularly concerned because the tiredness started suddenly about a month ago and hasn't improved with rest. I'm a 45-year-old woman with no major health issues.

Can you explain the difference between normal tiredness and fatigue that might indicate a health problem? I'm trying to figure out if my low energy levels are just from stress at work or if I should be worried about something more serious like anemia or thyroid issues.
I've had a really bad earache for the past 2 days and it's getting worse. The pain is sharp and throbbing, especially when I lie down. Is this an ear infection? What can I do to make it feel better?
my 4 year old keeps pulling at her left ear and crying. she also has a fever of 101F. could this be an ear infection? should i take her to the doctor or can i treat this at home

Hey, I went swimming in a lake last weekend and now my ear feels clogged and painful. There's also some yellowish discharge coming out. What's the best way to treat swimmer's ear? Can I just use over-the-counter drops?

I get frequent ear infections (like 3-4 times a year) and I'm tired of always needing antibiotics. Are there any natural remedies or preventative measures I can take to stop getting them so often? Also, how do I know when it's serious enough to see a doctor vs treating it myself?
I've had a sore throat for 3 days now and it hurts to swallow. What are some home remedies I can try to make it feel better?
hey my throat is killing me!! been gargling salt water but it's not helping much. what else can i do? don't want to take antibiotics if i don't have to

Can you give me a list of natural remedies for treating a sore throat? I prefer to avoid over-the-counter medications when possible. Also, how long should I wait before seeing a doctor if it doesn't improve?
What's the best way to treat a scratchy, painful throat? Mine started yesterday after being in cold weather. Should I use throat lozenges, honey, or something else?

I've been having really bad knee pain for the past few weeks, especially when I go up stairs or stand for too long. It's kind of a dull ache that gets sharp sometimes. Could this be arthritis? I'm only 35 so I thought I was too young for that
what are some natural remedies for joint pain? my fingers have been stiff in the mornings and it takes like 30 minutes for them to loosen up. i don't want to take prescription meds if i can avoid it

My doctor said I have osteoarthritis in my hips. Can you explain what that means and what I should expect? Also, are there specific exercises that are good or bad for this condition? I used to run a lot but now I'm scared to make it worse.

hey is it normal for arthritis pain to be worse when it rains?? my grandma always said her joints could predict the weather and now that i have rheumatoid arthritis i swear mine hurt more on cloudy days... also what otc pain meds work best for this?
I've been having a burning sensation when I pee for the past 2 days and I need to go to the bathroom way more often than usual. Could this be a UTI? What should I do about it?
what are the main symptoms of a urinary tract infection in women? also can you get one from holding your pee too long

My doctor said I have a UTI and prescribed antibiotics, but I'm wondering if there are any home remedies I can try alongside the medication to help with the discomfort? Like cranberry juice or something?

Is it normal for UTI symptoms to come back after finishing antibiotics? I completed my 5-day course last week but now I'm feeling that familiar burning again. Should I be worried or just go back to the doctor?

My eyes have been really red and itchy for the past 3 days, especially when I wake up in the morning. There's some crusty discharge too. Is this pink eye or just allergies? What over-the-counter drops would help?

i've been getting these random flashes of light in my peripheral vision, kinda like lightning bolts but only in my right eye... happens maybe 2-3 times a day for the past week. should i be worried about this??

Help! I work on a computer 10+ hours a day and lately my vision gets blurry by afternoon, plus I'm getting terrible headaches behind my eyes. My eyes also feel super dry and tired. What can I do to fix this? Are blue light glasses worth it?

Woke up this morning with my left eyelid swollen and there's a painful bump on it near the lash line. It's red and tender to touch. Is this a stye? How do I treat it at home and how long before it goes away?

I've been having a sharp pain in my upper left molar for the past 3 days. It gets worse when I drink anything cold or bite down on that side. I can't get to a dentist until next week - what can I do to manage the pain in the meantime?
help!! my gums have been bleeding every time i brush my teeth lately and they look kinda swollen and red around the bottom front teeth. is this gingivitis? what should i do about it?

My 7 year old daughter has been complaining that her tooth hurts, and I noticed there's a dark spot on one of her back teeth that looks like it might be a cavity. Should I wait for her regular checkup in 2 months or does she need to see the dentist sooner? Also what can help with her pain tonight?

I had a wisdom tooth extracted 4 days ago and the pain seems to be getting worse instead of better. The area where the tooth was feels empty and there's a terrible taste in my mouth. Could this be dry socket? What are the signs I should look for and when should I be worried enough to go back to the oral surgeon?
I've been having shortness of breath when climbing stairs lately, and it's getting worse. I'm 45 years old and don't smoke. Should I be worried? What could be causing this?
my asthma has been acting up more than usual this spring even though im taking my inhaler. are there any natural remedies or lifestyle changes that might help reduce the symptoms?

Help! My 6 year old daughter has been coughing for almost 2 weeks now. It's mostly dry but sometimes there's phlegm. No fever. We tried honey and cough syrup but nothing works. When should we see a doctor vs just waiting it out?

I wake up multiple times at night gasping for air and my partner says I snore really loudly. I'm always tired during the day no matter how much I sleep. Could this be sleep apnea? What are the treatment options if it is?
I've been feeling nauseous for the past 3 days, especially in the mornings. I haven't changed my diet and I'm not pregnant. What could be causing this?
My 8 year old has been throwing up since yesterday afternoon. No fever but she says her stomach hurts. Should I be worried? What are the common reasons kids get these symptoms?
hey so i keep getting really queasy after eating and sometimes i actually puke... this has been going on for like 2 weeks now. what causes chronic nausea like this??

What are the main causes of sudden onset vomiting in adults? I was completely fine this morning but after lunch I've thrown up twice and feel extremely nauseated. I don't think it's food poisoning because my coworker ate the same thing and is fine.
I've been constipated for 4 days now and nothing seems to help. I've tried drinking more water but still no bowel movement. What should I do? Is this dangerous?
hey doc, tmi but my poop has been really hard and painful to pass lately... like little pebbles. what foods should i eat to make things easier? also is miralax safe to take everyday?
What are the best natural remedies for chronic constipation? I don't want to rely on laxatives long-term. Also, how much fiber should I be eating per day and what are good sources?

I'm worried about my bowel habits - I only go once every 3-4 days but I don't feel constipated or uncomfortable. Is this normal or should I see a doctor? My diet is pretty healthy with vegetables and whole grains.
I've been feeling really dizzy when I stand up quickly, especially in the mornings. It's been happening for about a week now. Is this something I should be worried about or is it just dehydration?
help!! im having terrible spinning sensations and feel like im going to fall over. started yesterday after i got off a plane. cant even walk straight. what could this be???

My mom (67 years old) has been complaining about episodes of vertigo that last for about 30 seconds when she turns her head to the right. She says the room spins and she feels nauseous. Could this be BPPV? What home remedies might help her?

What's the difference between dizziness and vertigo? I get lightheaded sometimes and other times it feels like everything is moving around me, but I'm not sure how to describe it to my doctor or what might be causing each sensation.

I've been having really bad cramps during my period lately and ibuprofen isn't helping much anymore. Are there any other remedies or medications I should try? The pain is like a 7/10 and it's affecting my work.
hey so my periods have been super irregular for the past few months... sometimes i skip a month then get two really heavy ones close together. is this normal or should i be worried??

What are some natural ways to deal with PMS symptoms? I get really bad mood swings, bloating, and breast tenderness about a week before my period starts. I'd prefer to avoid hormonal birth control if possible.

My daughter just started her period and she's complaining about severe cramping that's making her miss school. What's considered normal for teenage girls and when should I take her to see a doctor? She's 13 and this is her third cycle.
My doctor said my blood pressure was 145/95 at my last checkup. What lifestyle changes should I make to bring it down naturally? I'm 52 and don't want to start medication if I can avoid it.
what foods should i avoid if i have high blood pressure? also are there specific foods that can help lower it?

I've been taking lisinopril for my hypertension for about 6 months now, but I still get readings around 135/85. Is this normal or should I ask my doctor about adjusting my medication? Also, how often should I be checking my blood pressure at home?

Can you explain the difference between systolic and diastolic blood pressure? Mine is usually something like 128/88 and I don't really understand what those numbers mean or which one is more important to worry about.

I've been feeling really thirsty lately and going to the bathroom a lot more than usual, especially at night. I also feel tired all the time even though I'm getting enough sleep. Could these be signs of diabetes? What other symptoms should I watch out for?
hey doc, my mom has type 2 diabetes and i'm worried i might get it too. what are the early warning signs i should look for? also what can i do to prevent it

I was just diagnosed with prediabetes and I'm freaking out a bit. Can you explain what foods I should avoid and what I should be eating instead? Also, how often should I be checking my blood sugar levels? I really don't want this to turn into full diabetes.

What's the difference between type 1 and type 2 diabetes symptoms? My teenager has been losing weight without trying, drinking tons of water, and seems exhausted all the time. We have a family history of diabetes but I'm not sure which type to be concerned about. Should we see a doctor right away?
I've been trying to lose weight for months but nothing seems to work. I cut calories to 1200 a day and exercise 5 times a week but the scale won't budge. What am I doing wrong?
hey doc, i'm 5'8 and weigh 210 lbs. my bmi says im obese but i dont feel that big. should i be worried? what's a healthy weight for someone my height

Can you help me understand why I keep gaining weight even though I haven't changed my diet? I'm a 45 year old woman and in the past year I've put on 15 pounds without eating any differently. My doctor just says it's normal aging but that doesn't seem right.
What's the safest way to lose 30 pounds in 3 months? I have a wedding coming up and really need to drop this weight fast. Are there any supplements or meal plans you'd recommend that actually work?

I've been feeling really dizzy and have a headache after working outside in the heat all day. I haven't been drinking much water. What are the signs that I might be dehydrated and what should I do about it?
can you explain what electrolyte imbalance is?? i keep hearing about it but don't really get it. also how do i know if i have it

My mom is 72 and she's been having muscle cramps in her legs, feeling very tired, and says her mouth is really dry. She doesn't drink much water because she doesn't want to go to the bathroom often. Could this be dehydration? What's the best way to help elderly people stay hydrated?

What's the difference between drinking plain water vs sports drinks like Gatorade when you're dehydrated? I've been having diarrhea for 2 days and feel weak - should I be taking electrolyte supplements or just drinking more water?
I ate some leftover chicken from 3 days ago and now I'm feeling really nauseous with stomach cramps. Could this be food poisoning? What symptoms should I watch out for?
what are the main signs of food poisoning vs just a stomach bug? trying to figure out if the sushi i had last night made me sick

My daughter has been vomiting and has diarrhea since this morning after eating at a restaurant yesterday. She also has a fever of 101°F. Are these typical food poisoning symptoms and when should I be concerned enough to see a doctor?

Help! I think I have food poisoning - started feeling sick about 4 hours after eating potato salad at a picnic. Symptoms are: severe stomach pain, sweating, feeling dizzy, and frequent trips to the bathroom. Is this normal for food poisoning or should I go to the ER?
I got stung by a bee on my arm about an hour ago and it's really swollen and red. The stinger is out but it hurts a lot. What should I do to reduce the swelling and pain?

My kid has multiple mosquito bites from camping last weekend that she keeps scratching, and now they look infected with some yellow crusty stuff. Should I be worried? What's the best way to treat them at home?

hey i think i got bit by a spider last night while sleeping... theres 2 small puncture marks on my leg and the area around it is kinda warm and tender. when should i see a doctor vs just treating it myself??

I found a tick embedded in my skin after hiking yesterday. I removed it with tweezers but I'm worried about Lyme disease. The bite area has a small red bump. How long should I monitor it and what symptoms should I watch for?

I spent all day at the beach yesterday without sunscreen and now my shoulders and back are bright red and really painful. It hurts to wear a shirt and the skin feels hot to touch. What's the best way to treat this sunburn at home? Should I be worried about how red it is?
what are the warning signs of heat stroke vs heat exhaustion? my dad was working outside in 95 degree weather and now he's dizzy and nauseous

Help! My 8 year old has been playing soccer in the sun all day. She's complaining of a headache, seems confused, and her skin is really hot but she's not sweating anymore. What should I do? Is this an emergency?

Hey I got a pretty bad sunburn on my face 2 days ago with some blistering on my nose and forehead. The blisters are starting to pop on their own. How do I prevent infection and scarring? Also when can I go back out in the sun safely?
I've been feeling really tired lately and my hair has been falling out more than usual. Could this be a vitamin deficiency? What supplements should I consider taking?

hey i just found out my vitamin d level is at 12 ng/ml from my blood test... my doctor is on vacation so i cant reach them. is this dangerous?? should i start taking supplements right away and how much
What are the signs of B12 deficiency? I'm vegan and worried I might not be getting enough. Also, is it true that some forms of B12 supplements are better absorbed than others?
Can you explain the difference between vitamin D2 and D3? I'm looking at supplements at the store and don't know which one to buy. Also, is it possible to take too much vitamin D?

My 4 year old has had a fever of 101F for 2 days now, runny nose, and seems really tired. She's eating less than usual but still drinking water. Should I take her to the doctor or wait it out? What can I do to help her feel better at home?
how long is hand foot and mouth disease contagious? my son was diagnosed 3 days ago and i need to know when he can go back to daycare

What are the typical symptoms of an ear infection in toddlers? My 18-month-old keeps pulling at his right ear and crying, especially at night. He doesn't have a fever though. Could this still be an ear infection or something else?

Hi, I think my daughter might have strep throat - she's 7 and complaining of a really sore throat since yesterday, has a fever of 102.5, and I can see white spots on her tonsils. Her breath also smells bad. Can strep go away on its own or does she definitely need antibiotics? What should I do until we can see the pediatrician tomorrow?
